bioghist.p: Charles Chakerian (1904-1994) was a professor at McCormick Theological Seminary, a sociologist, and an ordained Presbyterian minister. He taught for over 50 years and was also involved in children’s welfare and social work. He was a consultant for both the Church World Service and Christian Children’s Fund. He retired from McCormick Seminary in 1971. In 1975, while working with Presbyterian Volunteer Services, Chakerian went to Taiwan to teach at the Tainan Presbyterian College and Seminary. He stayed in that post for eight years, and then worked for two years helping to organize the First Graduate Institute of Social Work in Taiwan at Tunghai University.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes papers related to Chakerian's work with the Christian Children's Fund and the Church World Services, including reports on Korea, Vietnam, Brazil, Mexico, India, Taiwan, Laos, and other locations; material related to CCF's Family Helper Project; reports and articles on inter-country adoption; policy statements; meeting minutes from CCF; printed works by Chakerian on topics related to Church social services; magazine clippings; and a small number of travel notes and lecture notes. Materials from the Hartford Seminary Foundation include articles by Chakerian on Church social work and other topics, bulletins of the Greater Hartford Community Council, Connecticut State Planning Board reports, and reports on Presbyterian Settlement Houses. There is a small amount of correspondence and reports from his time at the McCormick Seminary.
